author: cnbc.com
title: United States Hispanic Chamber Of Commerce Selects RSR Partners To Conduct A Nationwide Search For A New CEO & President
text:
Washington, D.C., May 29, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The United States Hispanic Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors has selected Victor Arias , Managing Director at executive search and leadership consulting firm RSR Partners , to lead its national search for a new CEO and President.
Victor Arias is based in the firm’s Dallas office and serves as senior member of its Board Recruiting Practice. He earned his MBA from Stanford University and BBA from University of Texas at El Paso, where he was named Distinguished Alum in 2009. He is a trustee emeritus for the Stanford University board of trustees, the current Chairman of the Stanford Latino Entrepreneurship Initiative and a former member of the Stanford GSB Advisory council.
About USHCC
The USHCC actively promotes the economic growth, development and interests of more than 4.37 million Hispanic-owned businesses, that combined, contribute over $700 billion to the American economy every year. It also advocates on behalf of 260 major American corporations and serves as the umbrella organization for more than 200 local chambers and business associations nationwide. For more information, visit ushcc.com . Follow us on Twitter @USHCC.
About RSR Partners
RSR Partners is a leader in corporate governance consulting, board director and senior-level recruiting, and strategic talent advisory. The firm measures its success based on the value great leadership creates and the transformative impact it can have on its clients’ business. The company was founded in 1993 by its Chairman Russell S. Reynolds, Jr.
